<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>**Implementing React with Figma**

I need to implement React code based on the Figma design and ensure the index.html file works for previewing. There's already a static HTML demo in place. Using React 19, I wonder if we can create a simple entry point that runs via ESM with import maps. Without a bundler, it's tricky, but I think we can load React through unpkg CDN. This project builds TypeScript already, and I need to add a new entry for the Figma page while ensuring it outputs ESM modules properly.
**Using CDN for React**

Iâ€™m considering using a standalone file that doesnâ€™t directly import React but leverages the global React via CDN. In TSX, we need a JSX factory, and TypeScript requires React in scope. With React 17+, the automatic runtime mandates an import unless we set up tsconfig to use react-jsx, which wonâ€™t resolve in a browser anyway. A simpler method would be to directly load React and ReactDOM from the CDN in the index.html and define components using global React. Iâ€™ll also think about modifying the existing index.html to include a root div for rendering.
**Creating a New HTML File**

The user requested that I write some files. I think we should edit index.html to add a React mount and include CDN scripts, but since the project already has static content, it's better to create a new file, like figma-react.html, to avoid breaking anything. I'll create the FigmaOrders component in src/components/FigmaOrders.tsx, but running it in the browser without a bundler might be tricky. Instead, I could write inline React component code in figma-react.html, following the userâ€™s instructions. Iâ€™ll also make sure to include a citation for the Figma link.
**Creating the Figma React HTML File**

I need to use mcp_desktop-commander_write_file to create the figma-react.html file in the specified directory. My plan is to craft HTML that loads React and renders a component that matches the existing content from index.html. Iâ€™ll mount the component into a root element and use inline CSS similar to the index.html to keep it consistent. Iâ€™ll also maintain the same 4-space indentation as in the existing file, avoiding any reformatting. Let's go ahead and write this file!</details></think>

<body>
    <div id="root"></div>

    <!-- React via CDN (UMD) -->
    <script crossorigin src="https://unpkg.com/react@19/umd/react.production.min.js"></script>
    <script crossorigin src="https://unpkg.com/react-dom@19/umd/react-dom.production.min.js"></script>

    <script>
        // React Component: Orders Page based on Figma
        function StatusBadge({ type, children }) {
            const base = 'status-badge';
            return React.createElement('div', { className: base + ' ' + type }, children);
        }

        function PaymentTag({ children }) {
            return React.createElement('div', { className: 'payment-method' }, children);
        }

        function PaymentType({ children }) {
            return React.createElement('div', { className: 'payment-type' }, children);
        }

        function ChatIcon({ count }) {
            return (
                React.createElement('div', { className: 'chat-icon', onClick: function(){ alert('ì±„íŒ… ê¸°ëŠ¥ì´ í´ë¦­ë˜ì—ˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤!'); } },
                    React.createElement('div', { className: 'icon-container' },
                        React.createElement('div', { className: 'chat-icon-bg' }),
                        React.createElement('div', { className: 'chat-icon-content' })
                    ),
                    React.createElement('span', { className: 'chat-count' }, String(count)),
                    React.createElement('div', { className: 'arrow-icon' },
                        React.createElement('div', { className: 'arrow-bg' }),
                        React.createElement('div', { className: 'arrow-content' })
                    )
                )
            );
        }

        function ProductInfo({ title, desc, price }) {
            return (
                React.createElement('div', { className: 'product-info' },
                    React.createElement('div', { className: 'product-image', onClick: function(){ alert('ìƒí’ˆ ì´ë¯¸ì§€ë¥¼ í´ë¦­í–ˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤!'); } }),
                    React.createElement('div', { className: 'product-details' },
                        React.createElement('h3', { className: 'product-title' }, title),
                        React.createElement('div', { className: 'product-description' },
                            React.createElement('p', null, desc),
                            React.createElement('span', { className: 'price' }, price)
                        )
                    )
                )
            );
        }

        function OrderActions({ buttons }) {
            return (
                React.createElement('div', { className: 'action-buttons' },
                    buttons.map(function(b, idx) {
                        var cls = b.variant === 'secondary' ? 'btn-secondary' : 'btn-cancel';
                        return React.createElement('button', {
                            key: idx,
                            className: cls,
                            onClick: function(e){ e.preventDefault(); alert(b.label + ' ë²„íŠ¼ì´ í´ë¦­ë˜ì—ˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤!'); }
                        }, b.label);
                    })
                )
            );
        }

        function OrderItem({ status, paymentMethod, paymentType, title, desc, price, orderNo, actions }) {
            return (
                React.createElement('div', { className: 'order-item' },
                    React.createElement('div', { className: 'order-header' },
                        React.createElement('div', { className: 'status-badges' },
                            React.createElement(StatusBadge, { type: status.type }, status.text),
                            React.createElement(PaymentTag, null, paymentMethod),
                            React.createElement(PaymentType, null, paymentType)
                        )
                    ),
                    React.createElement(ProductInfo, { title: title, desc: desc, price: price }),
                    React.createElement('div', { className: 'order-actions' }, React.createElement(ChatIcon, { count: 0 })),
                    React.createElement('div', { className: 'order-number' }, orderNo),
                    React.createElement('div', { className: 'divider' }),
                    actions && actions.length ? React.createElement(OrderActions, { buttons: actions }) : null
                )
            );
        }

        function DateHeader({ date }) {
            return (
                React.createElement('div', { className: 'header-section' },
                    React.createElement('div', { className: 'date-header' },
                        React.createElement('span', { className: 'date-text' }, date)
                    )
                )
            );
        }

        function OrdersPage() {
            const itemsDay1 = [
                { status: { type: 'waiting', text: 'ì…ê¸ˆëŒ€ê¸°' }, title: 'ë””ì˜¤íŠ¸ 2ì¸µ C26 JUNO (ì£¼ë…¸)', desc: 'ë©”ì‰¬ë§ì‚¬ ë°°ìƒ‰ ì¤„ì§€ë‹ˆíŠ¸ ì™¸ 2ê±´', price: '30,000ì›', orderNo: '20210104900639', actions: [ { label: 'ì£¼ë¬¸ì·¨ì†Œ', variant: 'cancel' }, { label: 'ê³„ì¢Œí™•ì¸', variant: 'secondary' } ] },

                { status: { type: 'processing', text: 'ì‚¬ì…ì¤‘' }, title: 'ë””ì˜¤íŠ¸ 2ì¸µ C26 JUNO (ì£¼ë…¸)', desc: 'ë©”ì‰¬ë§ì‚¬ ë°°ìƒ‰ ì¤„ì§€ë‹ˆíŠ¸ ì™¸ 2ê±´', price: '30,000ì›', orderNo: '20210104900639', actions: [] },
                { status: { type: 'received', text: 'ì…ê³ ì™„ë£Œ' }, title: 'ë””ì˜¤íŠ¸ 2ì¸µ C26 JUNO (ì£¼ë…¸)', desc: 'ë©”ì‰¬ë§ì‚¬ ë°°ìƒ‰ ì¤„ì§€ë‹ˆíŠ¸ ì™¸ 2ê±´', price: '30,000ì›', orderNo: '20210104900639', actions: [ { label: 'ì£¼ë¬¸ì·¨ì†Œ', variant: 'cancel' }, { label: 'ë°°ì†¡ì¡°íšŒ', variant: 'secondary' }, { label: 'ë¯¸ì†¡ ë°°ì†¡ì¡°íšŒ', variant: 'secondary' } ] }
            ];

                { status: { type: 'shipping', text: 'ë°°ì†¡ì¤‘' }, title: 'ë””ì˜¤íŠ¸ 2ì¸µ C26 JUNO (ì£¼ë…¸)', desc: 'ë©”ì‰¬ë§ì‚¬ ë°°ìƒ‰ ì¤„ì§€ë‹ˆíŠ¸ ì™¸ 2ê±´', price: '30,000ì›', orderNo: '20210104900639', actions: [ { label: 'ë°°ì†¡ì¡°íšŒ', variant: 'secondary' } ] },

                React.createElement('div', { className: 'container' },
                    React.createElement('div', { className: 'demo-info' },
                        React.createElement('h1', null, 'ì£¼ë¬¸ ê´€ë¦¬ UI (Figma â†’ React)'),
                        React.createElement('p', null, 'Figma ë””ìì¸ì„ Reactë¡œ ë³€í™˜í•œ ë¯¸ë¦¬ë³´ê¸°')

Tool use: **mcp_desktop-commander_edit_block**

<details>
          <summary>MCP tool call</summary>
      
*Called tool*: desktop-commander - edit_block: 
                        Apply surgical text replacements to files.
                        
                        BEST PRACTICE: Make multiple small, focused edits rather than one large edit.
                        Each edit_block call should change only what needs to be changed - include just enough 
                        context to uniquely identify the text being modified.
                        
                        Takes:
                        - file_path: Path to the file to edit
                        - old_string: Text to replace
                        - new_string: Replacement text
                        - expected_replacements: Optional parameter for number of replacements
                        
                        By default, replaces only ONE occurrence of the search text.
                        To replace multiple occurrences, provide the expected_replacements parameter with
                        the exact number of matches expected.
                        
                        UNIQUENESS REQUIREMENT: When expected_replacements=1 (default), include the minimal
                        amount of context necessary (typically 1-3 lines) before and after the change point,
                        with exact whitespace and indentation.
                        
                        When editing multiple sections, make separate edit_block calls for each distinct change
                        rather than one large replacement.
                        
                        When a close but non-exact match is found, a character-level diff is shown in the format:
                        common_prefix{-removed-}{+added+}common_suffix to help you identify what's different.
                        
                        Similar to write_file, there is a configurable line limit (fileWriteLineLimit) that warns
                        if the edited file exceeds this limit. If this happens, consider breaking your edits into
                        smaller, more focused changes.
                        
                        IMPORTANT: Always use absolute paths for reliability. Paths are automatically normalized regardless of slash direction. Relative paths may fail as they depend on the current working directory. Tilde paths (~/...) might not work in all contexts. Unless the user explicitly asks for relative paths, use absolute paths.
                        This command can be referenced as "DC: ..." or "use Desktop Commander to ..." in your instructions.

*Parameters*:
  * file_path: /Users/eos/workspaces/study/palette/figma-react.html
  * old_string:     <!-- React via CDN (UMD) -->
    <script crossorigin src="https://unpkg.com/react@19/umd/react.production.min.js"></script>
    <script crossorigin src="https://unpkg.com/react-dom@19/umd/react-dom.production.min.js"></script>
  * new_string:     <!-- React via CDN (UMD) -->
    <script crossorigin src="https://unpkg.com/react@18.3.1/umd/react.production.min.js"></script>
    <script crossorigin src="https://unpkg.com/react-dom@18.3.1/umd/react-dom.production.min.js"></script>
  * expected_replacements: 1

*Result*:

Tool use: **mcp_desktop-commander_write_file**

<details>
          <summary>MCP tool call</summary>
      
*Called tool*: desktop-commander - write_file: 
                        Write or append to file contents. 

                        CHUNKING IS STANDARD PRACTICE: Always write files in chunks of 25-30 lines maximum.
                        This is the normal, recommended way to write files - not an emergency measure.

                        STANDARD PROCESS FOR ANY FILE:
                        1. FIRST â†’ write_file(filePath, firstChunk, {mode: 'rewrite'})  [â‰¤30 lines]
                        2. THEN â†’ write_file(filePath, secondChunk, {mode: 'append'})   [â‰¤30 lines]
                        3. CONTINUE â†’ write_file(filePath, nextChunk, {mode: 'append'}) [â‰¤30 lines]

                        ALWAYS CHUNK PROACTIVELY - don't wait for performance warnings!

                        WHEN TO CHUNK (always be proactive):
                        1. Any file expected to be longer than 25-30 lines
                        2. When writing multiple files in sequence
                        3. When creating documentation, code files, or configuration files
                        
                        HANDLING CONTINUATION ("Continue" prompts):
                        If user asks to "Continue" after an incomplete operation:
                        1. Read the file to see what was successfully written
                        2. Continue writing ONLY the remaining content using {mode: 'append'}
                        3. Keep chunks to 25-30 lines each
                        
                        Files over 50 lines will generate performance notes but are still written successfully.
                        Only works within allowed directories.
                        
                        IMPORTANT: Always use absolute paths for reliability. Paths are automatically normalized regardless of slash direction. Relative paths may fail as they depend on the current working directory. Tilde paths (~/...) might not work in all contexts. Unless the user explicitly asks for relative paths, use absolute paths.
                        This command can be referenced as "DC: ..." or "use Desktop Commander to ..." in your instructions.

*Parameters*:

        function FAQSection(){
            var _React$useState = React.useState([false, false, false]), openStates = _React$useState[0], setOpenStates = _React$useState[1];
            function toggle(idx){
                var next = openStates.slice();
                next[idx] = !next[idx];
                setOpenStates(next);
            }
            return (

                    React.createElement('div', { className: 'faq-title' }, 'ìì£¼ ë¬»ëŠ” ì§ˆë¬¸'),

- ìƒë‹¨ ë„¤ë¹„/ì œëª©/ì´ìš©ì•ˆë‚´
